page.title: 16Public Pathways
page.content: There are many footpaths around Dadlington and Stoke Golding which provide pleasant walking for the puplic.As many of the paths through farmland, the walker must remember to close the gates. A popular path runs alongside the Ashby Canal. It is,in fact, the towpath and is still used by a horse- aptly named"Bosworth" who draws a pleasure barge. There are trackways through Ambion Wood but these are virtually impassable in the summer as the vegetationis very dense. The paths through Lodge Farmhave been renovated recently to cope with the expected influx of visitors celebrating the 500th Anniversary of the Battle of Bosworth.
